hackathon-description-text: The goal of ycitesee Hackathon and Design Jam Day is to explore and build the next generation of travel applications. It's a full day of hacking in which participants will conceptualize, create and present their hacks at the close of the day. (Well will ensure you are comfortable, enjoy good food and leave with a swag bag. We are supporting Kumasi Children's Home & Orphanage, Ghana. More about that on the day. Please feel free to make a donation on the day.) We will be using the Pearson Eye Witness Guides travel API with access to points of interest, travel and activity data for 9 popular city destinations. Be inspired by the data to create awesome travel products! Anything goes as long as it's travel related.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Serial Entrepreneur and Director Innovation Warehouse

hackathon-requirements: This is a travel hackathon anything travel goes e.g.:
hackathon-rules:
All code must be new! Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, 
wireframes, logo, and user flows. Either enter as a team or as an 
individual. You can can access the Pearson Eye Witness Guides API,
 from 5th - 9th August to prepare. For access to the Pearson API key 
please email us. But to make things completely fair you cannot write 
any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built 
at the ycitesee Hackathon & Design Jam.
Email: ycitesee@gmail.com
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 East Poultry Avenue, London, Greater London EC1A 9PT, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
We will be asking the judges the consider the following criteria when judging:

Creative use of Pearson Eyewitness Guides API
Application Design/UX
Technical Wow!

hackathon-location-address: 1 East Poultry Avenue, London, Greater London EC1A 9PT, UK
hackathon-description-header: A travel hackathon & design jam inspiring the next generation of travel products
